job_title: Academic Support Specialist in Cedar Falls, IA
pros: Excellent benefits despite poor wages. Good working conditions and infrastructure. People are, in my opinion, "Iowa Nice".
cons: Pay seems low. May jobs are open but they appear to go unfilled. in my opinion it is due to very low pay for work demanding high education requirements.

job_title: Social Media Coordinator in Cedar Falls, IA
pros: The department is very good at working around class schedule.
cons: The pay is barely above minimum wage, and they have a strict limit about how many hours you can work. The administration is also somewhat opaque when describing tasks.

job_title: Assistant Professor in Cedar Falls, IA
pros: Small teaching department made the 1st year transition into Higher Education a bit more intimate than I feel it would've been if I worked in a huge department.
cons: Didn't have the support I needed as a BIPOC faculty member.

job_title: Rock Wall Supervisor in Cedar Falls, IA
pros: The Rock Wall was a fantastic job as a UNI student. The hours were flexible. The community and co-workers are a fun and friendly group (the vibes are always shifting as people rotate in and out). They've got a music speaker so you can queue up your own non-explicit music, as opposed to having to listen to the music played over the main WRC speakers. The boss at the time of writing, Andrew Martin, was the best boss I've had by far.
cons: Low pay, can't work more than about 20 hours or so per week (at the time of writing) and this limit transfers across all UNI student jobs (to my knowledge).

review_title: CBGI was a great place to learn about the professional world!
job_title: Marketing Assistant in Cedar Falls, IA
pros:
Great way to learn and earn while getting a degree! The Center for Business Growth and Innovation had a very cool atmosphere and team to learn the ins and outs of the world of business. With very flexible hours, team morale, and a student focused learning environment, I was very happy with my time at CBGI and miss it!

I also had an incredible boss who inspired me and helped me grow in my career and as a person. Thanks Ricki!
cons: Not many downsides, but if I had to choose it would maybe be the area near us had a high school program that would get loud but other than that nothing comes to mind.

job_title: Marketing in Cedar Falls, IA
pros: Great rewarding work for sure.
cons: Wish we could work more than 20 hours a week.

review_title: Amazing Supervisor and Heart Warming Work

job_title: Anonymous Employee in Cedar Falls, IA
pros:
- Benefits at UNI were awesome!
- Loved the programs that the Center for Business Growth and Innovation managed and the people we got to interact with around the state (entrepreneurs and small business owners).
- Always so much work to do, so no getting bored on the job.
cons:
- Work is not appreciated or acknowledged (you will be called out if you make a mistake though!)
- Director was not a nice guy! On a weekly basis there was screaming, crying, and pointing fingers. This was all coming from grown adults with children. Made the environment EXTREMELY hard to work in. I was so stressed out I was physically getting sick.
- Extreme discrimination of the ladies in the office! As a woman, I was teased and assigned most of the "busy work" that the boss didn't want to do (on top of my other responsibilities). Leadership events/roles were never an option for the women. I would get interrupted and talked over at every single meeting. Boss literally said to me in front of my peers, "You don't matter." Also, pay for the ladies was significantly less than the men, even though we were putting in a ton of work (public employees, so I knew what everyone else made).
- HR and upper management didn't seem too concerned to help the situation.
- Worked to death at times- 70+ hours with travel (no overtime pay)
- No clear opportunities for advancement or career growth.

job_title: Student Assistant in Cedar Falls, IA
pros: Fun people to work with
cons: Nothing bad to say about it

job_title: Assistant Professor in Cedar Falls, IA
pros: The people here are really great
cons: Not too much - it's a good place

job_title: Anonymous Employee in Cedar Falls, IA
pros: Good Comm department, nice professors.
cons: horrible administration. They only care about making money off of you.

job_title: Program Manager in Cedar Falls, IA
pros: Very focused on student and safety.  Beautiful campus. Majority of building are centralized which is convenient for students.
cons: UNI continues to tout that its an a leader in education but the state of Iowa continues to fall in the ranks compared to other states.  Time to get real. Departments operate as silos -inefficient with money and resources. Tenure is an antiquated business concept that should have been eliminated in 1980. No other business guarantees an employee retirement without proving their value every year (performance review). There is no incentive to do more as everyone gets the same meager % raise each year.

job_title: Instructor in Cedar Falls, IA
pros: High degree of support for professional development and creative control. While I was a teacher at the lab school, my position and the expectations were equivalent to a university course instructor.
cons: Low pay comparable to public school salaries, no job security. Tenure track jobs were not available to much of the lab school staff, and the pay was at least $10,000 less than I made prior in public schools.

job_title: Graduate Assistant in Cedar Falls, IA
pros: They offer(ed) their graduate students full and partial tuition reimbursement for working under a professor, as their assistant. I was also offered the opportunity to earn an hourly wage for extra research that was needed for a project.
cons: Their MSW program was extremely weak and underwhelming. I was not challenged by the courses or the work I did for my Graduate Assistant job.

review_title: Check turnover rates before you accept any offer
job_title: Assistant Professor in New York, NY
pros: The students! I truly loved working with them.
cons: I worked at UNI for 11 years.  In that time, I was under four different department heads.  The constant turnover made it tough for anything to gain and maintain traction.  There was constantly a different vision, different goals, and different egos to stroke.  Student body numbers have been plummeting, resulting in some serious instability college wide.

job_title: Adjunct in Cedar Falls, IA
pros: The people are very supportive and are willing to help you grow. The students are wonderful and hard working. I loved the freedom i had to create my courses.
cons: Sometime work is a little too self directed. It would be nice if senior staff members would sit in on lectures to help critique new professor. Feedback from students is helpful but one sided, so feedback from senior colleagues would give a more rounded, less personally invested picture.

review_title: Great benefits, poor vision and future growth potential
job_title: Anonymous Employee in Cedar Falls, IA
pros: Great benefits.  Nice time off.  Security once full time.
cons: Poor vision.  Does not have strong leadership.  Too many silos were people do not see the business as a whole rather their own business unit.

job_title: Work Study in Cedar Falls, IA
pros: My work at UNI gave me lots of hands-on experience for the career I was gaining education to acquire. I worked in two separate departments there, but I got the same great attention and guidance overall.
cons: Funds were supplied by the Work Study program for the second job, so I had to work a minimum amount of hours per week.
